text: <@U07KCCF0V|nick> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/nick/F6ELUA4DR/factorized-variational-autoencoders-for-modeling-audience-reactions-to-movies-paper.pdf|Factorized-Variational-Autoencoders-for-Modeling-Audience-Reactions-to-Movies-Paper.pdf> and commented: Imagine an animated film where the characters all make the face you're expected to make immediately after you make it. The emotional measurement>feedback loop potential, if it's used for steering future emotions, is HyperDisney.  it'd be the human emotional equivalent of a cow milking machine + everyday BGH injections. May the gods have mercy upon all the soft and impressionable minds that are going to melted into dripping putty in the coming decade.

text: I’m confused about this paper. Is the idea that the generalized model can understand an arbitrary film, or just that the eigendistance between any two audience members’ facial expressions tend to be of similar magnitude within one film
the performance and convergence they get so quickly is really impressive
